longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of French Polynesia are allowed to enter with an
  expired passport. The passport is accepted when expired for
  a maximum of 5 years.
- Nationals of France are allowed to enter with expired (max.
  5 years) National ID Cards issued  
- National ID cards issued to nationals of French Polynesia
  must be valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of French
  Polynesia.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for nationals
of French Polynesia.
Minors:
- Up to/incl. 18 years of age may be included in parent's
  passport. 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of French Polynesia will be
  expected to hold their own passport or National ID Card
  (where applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia,
  Cyprus, Romania or a Schengen Member State
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very low - exists from May to October in the
  provinces of Diyarbakir, Mardin and Sanliurfa. There is no
  malaria risk in the main tourist areas in the west and
  south-west of the country. Recommended prevention in risk
  areas: A.
